result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASES: 14CF404, 14CF475, 15CF79 Defendant Dominic L Koch in court with attorney James H. Krave.  Defendant Dominic L Koch in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 2:21pm  

15CF79 Ct 1: Def plea of G. All parties waive PSI.  CT accepts plea, finds G, enters JOC. DRI 14CF475, DRI 14CF404 Cts 2 & 3. 

SENTENCING ON 15CF79 Ct 1: I/S 6 yrs prison 3 IC, 3 ES, eligible for Earned Release and CIP, I/S 180 banked jail time to be used by agent if necessary, 183 days sent credit, prob- 5 yrs- appear by noon on 6/19/15, must obtain HSED, must complete 10 hrs CS each year while on Prob for a total of 50 hrs CS- can complete all 50 in one year, but must do at least 10 hrs per year, no contact w/ Jorian Freiseis, $290.60 fine/cost, $250 DNA surcharge & DNA sample, Cannot possess firearms or body armor, cannot vote or hold public office. if not us citizen, could be deported. Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no illegal substances and no paraphernalia. PP of $25/mo beg 9/1/15 and 1st of e/m thereafter. AODA assess & comply. 2:49pm adj.
Final pre-trial at 06-18-2015 01:30 pm
Final pre-trial at 06-12-2015 10:00 am

CASES:  14CF475, 14CF404, 15CF79.  Defendant Dominic L Koch in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dominic L Koch in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Defendant Dominic L Koch incustody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KK Clerk 10:30AM CASES:  14CF404 and 13CF169 and 14CF475.

13CF169  --  Sentencing on revocation taken up first:  No corrections to Revocation packet.  ADA Sortedahl - 30 days PCJ.  TIME SERVED.  Atty Biller requesting that days sat over the 30 days be credited to other file.  Court - 30 days PCJ.  TIME Served.  Has already sat 70days.  $185.60 costs/fines.  Atty Bill in amount of $422.50 these both to be reduced to civil judgments.  

14CF404 -- Prelim. hearing  -- Sgt Stoffel S/T.  May need Investigator Vitalis in court to Testify for Prelim. Hearing.  30 days to file information with judge's rulings.  Atty Biller requesting hearing on Bond in 14CF475 - requesting converted sig bond with compet. of treatment.  State opposes the change of bond in 14CF475.  Court - dismiss 1 w/o prej.  Finds PC.  Bound over on Felony.  Proceed on counts 2 and 3.  Bond continue. Motion for Bond Modification in 14CF475 is denied.  adj.  10:54AM  Arraignment scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
State's - Submitted by ADA Sortedahl
PLea of NG and Defense Motions.  Submitted by Atty Biller.
Ct reads Information.  DE pleads NG - Ct accepts NG plea.

10:47 Defendant Dominic L Koch in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Defendant Dominic L Koch in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk   Ct - receives PQW.  Ct reviews PQW w/Mr Koch.  Ct binds over for further proceedings.  Ct provides Information to Ct.  Ct will proceed w/arraingment.  Bond continues.  Br 1 to schedule.  10:52 adj.
Preliminary hearing on December 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.
To Judge from Assistant P Stanek - requesting to reschedule.
Preliminary hearing on December 26, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.  Not to commit any new crimes.  Must appear at all future court appearances.  Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.  Not to have contact with: Jorian Freiseis and Tracy Eckstrom.   Must have clean UA before release from jail.
